text: The Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Art Direction for a Single-Camera Series is a retired award that was handed out annually at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards. In 2014, the category was restructured into Outstanding Production Design for a Narrative Contemporary or Fantasy Program (One Hour or More), Outstanding Production Design for a Narrative Program (Half-Hour or Less) and Outstanding Production Design for a Narrative Period Program (One Hour or More). ==Winners and nominations== ===1950s=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:100%" |- bgcolor="#bebebe" ! width="5%" | Year ! width="20%" | Program ! width="35%" | Episode(s) ! width="35%" | Nominees ! width="5%" | Network |- | rowspan=14 style="text-align:center" | 1956 |- ! colspan="6"| Outstanding Art Direction for a Film Series |- style="background:#FAEB86" | colspan=2| You Are There | William Ferrari | CBS |- | colspan=2| Four Star Playhouse | Duncan Cramer | CBS |- | colspan=2| Medic | Ernst Fegté | NBC |- | colspan=2| Robin Hood | Peter Proud | rowspan=2| CBS |- | colspan=2| Schlitz Playhouse | Serge Krizman |- ! colspan="6"| Outstanding Art Direction for a Live Series |- style="background:#FAEB86" | colspan=2| Playwrights '56 and Producers' Showcase | Otis Riggs | NBC |- | colspan=2| Alice in Wonderland and The Good Fairy (Hallmark Hall of Fame) | Jan Scott | NBC |- | colspan=2| Climax! | James D. title: Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Art Direction for a Single-Camera Series
